title: Raincoat, bloodstain and silence: Grim clue found as search for missing bride continues
content: Meghalaya Police discovered a stained 3XL raincoat near Sohra during the search for Sonam Raghuvanshi, whose husband, Raja, was found murdered. Forensic tests are underway to determine if the stains are blood and if the raincoat matches Sonam's.

title: Communal post case: Influencer Sharmishtha gets bail by Calcutta HC; to furnish bail bond of Rs 10,000
content: The Calcutta High Court granted interim bail to social media influencer Sharmishtha Panoli, arrested for allegedly hurting religious sentiments through an Instagram video. The court instructed the state to provide basic amenities to Panoli while in custody and restrained authorities from filing new FIRs on the same grounds.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Deputy CM DK Shivakumar breaks down; watch video
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, in tears, addressed the media following a stampede near Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB victory celebrations, resulting in 11 deaths and over 70 injuries. He apologized for the tragedy, acknowledging the government underestimated the crowd size.

title: Israel recovers bodies of two hostages from Gaza - Judih Weinstein and Gad Haggai
content: Israeli forces announced the recovery of the bodies of Judih Weinstein, 70, and Gad Haggai, 72, hostages taken during the October 7 Hamas attack. The couple, from Kibbutz Nir Oz, were killed during the attack, their bodies found in Khan Younis. The October 7 attack resulted in approximately 1,200 deaths and 251 hostages.

title: IND vs ENG: England announce squad for 1st Test; check who made the team
content: England has announced its 14-member squad for the first Test against India, commencing on June 20, 2025, at Headingley. Jamie Overton returns, replacing the injured Gus Atkinson. Ben Stokes captains a team featuring experienced players like Joe Root and Zak Crawley.

title: AI killing jobs: Google AI CEO Hassabis has a tip; If I were a student..
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis advises students to prioritize STEM subjects and embrace AI tools for future job market success. Speaking at SXSW London, he emphasized the importance of understanding mathematical and scientific fundamentals. Hassabis predicts AI will create valuable jobs for technically skilled individuals, urging students to gain hands-on experience with AI systems.

title: 'Allu Arjun was arrested, why not Siddaramaiah and Shivakumar?' asks BJP's Sambit Patra
content: Following a stampede at Royal Challengers Bangalore's victory march in Bengaluru, which resulted in 11 deaths, the BJP has fiercely criticized the Congress-led Karnataka government. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra held CM Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar responsible, demanding their resignation. Patra questioned the event's organization, crowd control, and continuation of celebrations amidst the tragedy, calling it a 'government-manufactured tragedy'.

title: Vande Bharat trains for Kashmir: Check full schedule
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the Udhampur-Srinagar-Baramulla Railway Link on June 6. The launch includes the Chenab and Anji Khad railway bridges. Two new Vande Bharat trains will also be flagged off. Regular Vande Bharat services to Kashmir will commence on June 7, 2025. These trains will initially run from Katra to Srinagar six days a week.

title: 'Gang-raped 8 times in front of mother': BJP functionary arrested with boyfriend
content: A BJP functionary in Haridwar and her boyfriend were arrested for allegedly orchestrating the gang-rape of her 13-year-old daughter. The abuse, which occurred multiple times between January and March, involved forcing the girl to consume alcohol and threatening her to silence. The survivor disclosed the ordeal to her father, leading to the arrests and ongoing search for a third suspect.

title: Microsoft reshuffles leadership: LinkedIn CEO to lead Office team
content: Microsoft is undergoing a leadership reshuffle, with LinkedIn CEO Ryan Roslansky expanding his role to oversee core Office products like Word and Excel, along with the Copilot AI offering. Roslansky will report to Rajesh Jha, head of Microsoft's Windows unit. This marks the second reshuffle in three months, following the appointment of a new Chief People Officer in March.

title: 'No need to ask us to stop': Tharoor on Rahul's 'Narender, surrender' jibe at PM
content: Shashi Tharoor is currently leading a delegation in the US. He responds to Rahul Gandhi's controversial remark. Tharoor shifts focus to Indian unity. He highlights the delegation's diversity. Tharoor dismisses concerns about criticism overshadowing the mission. He reiterates India's stance on US mediation in India-Pakistan tensions. Rahul Gandhi alleged Narendra Modi acted on Trump's cue.

title: NEET aspirant shoots himself after checking answer key in Bhopal
content: Nikhil Pratap Rathore, an 18-year-old NEET aspirant with a stellar academic record, tragically died by suicide after reviewing the answer key and finding his score lower than anticipated. Overwhelmed by stress, he used his father's licensed pistol to take his own life, leaving his family and friends in shock. Police have seized the weapon and are investigating all possible angles.

title: War twist: Ukraine’s drone used my open-source code, says shocked developer
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: What is Autopen? Signature device used by Biden to sign pardons
content: Donald Trump has ignited controversy over President Biden's alleged use of an autopen for signing pardons, deeming it a "political scandal." Autopens, mechanical devices replicating signatures, have been used by past presidents for routine documents. Trump questions the validity of pardons signed with an autopen, particularly those for his son Hunter, siblings, Gen. Milley, Dr.

title: What went wrong? Bengaluru stampede through survivors’ lens
content: A tragic stampede at Bengaluru's M. Chinnaswamy Stadium claimed eleven lives and injured 75 during a celebration for Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s (RCB) anticipated IPL victory. Overcrowding near stadium entrances triggered panic, leading to the deadly rush. Eyewitnesses described a chaotic scene with collapsed barricades, police intervention, and desperate attempts to escape.

title: 'We don’t want them': What prompted Trump’s travel ban on 12 nations
content: President Trump has announced a sweeping travel ban impacting nationals from over a dozen countries, citing security concerns and inadequate vetting procedures. The restrictions, implemented through a presidential proclamation, introduce a tiered system of barriers affecting work, study, tourism, and relocation. Exemptions are granted for athletes participating in the 2026 FIFA World Cup and the 2028 Olympic Games.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Virat, Anushka return to Mumbai; tragedy overshadows RCB celebration
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Mumbai after RCB's IPL victory celebration, which was overshadowed by a tragic stampede in Bengaluru. The stampede, occurring during the team's homecoming, resulted in 11 fatalities and numerous injuries. Kohli expressed his grief, and the RCB franchise conveyed condolences, turning a moment of triumph into one of mourning.

title: Bengaluru stampede: ‘Pushed from all sides, then fell'; eyewitness recounts horror
content: A celebratory parade for Royal Challengers Bengaluru turned tragic as a massive crowd surge led to chaos and fatalities. Among the victims were a young girl, a tech worker, and a student, all caught in the crush. Families are now grappling with the sudden loss of their loved ones, highlighting the devastating consequences of the uncontrolled event.

title: Bengaluru stampede: From joy to horror; timeline of tragedy that claimed 11 lives
content: Celebrations turned tragic in Bengaluru. A stampede occurred outside Chinnaswamy Stadium. Eleven people died and many were injured. The incident happened during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade. Poor planning and lack of crowd control led to the disaster. Officials cited political pressure and communication breakdown. The state government has ordered an inquiry and announced compensation.

title: 'Bilawal Bhutto's mother was assassinated': Tharoor slams Pak; invokes Clinton's 'vipers' rebuke
content: Shashi Tharoor, leading a parliamentary delegation to the US, strongly criticized Pakistan for its alleged support of terrorism, responding to Pakistan's diplomatic efforts led by Bilawal Bhutto. Tharoor highlighted India's position following 'Operation Sindoor' and the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing the need to counter Pakistani narratives through media engagement and direct outreach.

title: ‘Born in Maharashtra, must be named in Marathi’: Penguins now part of language row
content: A controversy surrounds the naming of penguin chicks at Mumbai's Byculla Zoo. BJP leaders are demanding Marathi names for the newborns. They oppose the current English names like Noddy, Tom, and Pingu. The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has not responded to appeals. The chicks hatched in March to parents Popeye, Olive, Daisy and Donald.

title: Stock market today: Nifty above 24,800; Sensex up over 800 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly on Thursday. While Nifty50 was above 24,800, BSE Sensex was up over 800 points.

title: LGBTQIA+ couples have right to find a family: Madras high court
content: Madras High Court affirmed that individuals can form families regardless of the Supreme Court's stance on same-sex marriage, recognizing 'chosen families' in LGBTQIA+ jurisprudence. The court criticized the use of 'queer' to describe non-heterosexual individuals and condemned the police's insensitive handling of a case involving a lesbian woman separated from her partner, ordering protection for the couple.

title: Bengaluru stampede: CM Siddaramaiah name-drops 'Maha Kumbh'
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah addressed the Bengaluru stampede that resulted in 11 fatalities, ordering a magisterial inquiry while refraining from defending the incident. He referenced past tragedies like the Kumbh Mela, while the BJP criticized the Congress-led government for negligence, citing inadequate planning and security.

title: Happy Eid-ul-Adha 2025: Eid Mubarak Images, wishes, msgs, cards, greetings & gifs
content: As the alluring moon is sighted and prayers across the skies echo, the heart of every Muslim will soon be filled with gratitude, love, and anticipation, as Eid-ul-Adha is right around the corner.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Was Virat aware of people dying outside? Ex-India cricketer asks
content: Following a stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL trophy celebration, a former India cricketer questioned if Virat Kohli and RCB players were aware of the tragedy. He believes Kohli wouldn't have continued celebrating if he knew of the deaths, while criticizing politicians and the RCB franchise for prioritizing revenue.

title: BSF jawan dragged across border by Bangladeshi criminals; returns after flag meet
content: A BSF jawan, Shri Ganesh, was forcibly dragged into Bangladesh by Bangladeshi nationals near the Chandni Chowk border outpost. The incident occurred while he was questioning them, leading to his detention in Satrashiya village. Following a flag meeting between BSF and BGB, he was returned after four hours, with BSF denying initial assault claims and vowing to prevent future occurrences.

title: Eid al-Adha holiday: Are banks open or closed on June 6 & 7? Check details
content: Eid al-Adha is anticipated to be celebrated in India on June 7, potentially marking a public holiday with closures for schools, colleges, and government offices. Banks will observe closures on June 6 in Thiruvananthapuram and Kochi, with varied operations on June 7 across different cities. Stock markets (NSE & BSE) will remain open, while digital banking services will continue uninterrupted.

title: PM Modi marks Environment Day; plants Sindoor at residence - watch video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi commemorated World Environment Day by planting a Sindoor sapling, gifted by women from Kutch recognised for their courage during the 1971 war. This symbolic gesture follows India's Operation Sindoor, a retaliatory action against terror bases after the Pahalgam attack, where the Prime Minister declared that sindoor now represents India's strength.

title: '3 lakh thronged Chinnaswamy Stadium that can hold just 35 thousand'
content: Tragedy struck Bengaluru as a massive stampede during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory parade resulted in 11 fatalities and 75 injuries. An overwhelming crowd of approximately three lakh people gathered outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium, far exceeding its capacity. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah stated that the government and KSCA underestimated the turnout, announcing compensation for the victims' families.

title: Bengaluru stampede: 'Free ticket' rumour sparked stadium chaos that killed 11
content: Chaos erupted at Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium's Gate No. 7 as massive crowds gathered on rumors of free tickets to celebrate RCB's anticipated IPL victory. A stampede ensued, exacerbated by sudden rain, leading to numerous injuries. Eyewitnesses reported poor crowd management and delayed decisions regarding a victory parade contributed to the disaster.

title: Trump bans entry of nationals from 12 countries. Who is on the list?
content: President Trump has implemented a travel ban on nationals from 12 countries, citing national security concerns related to screening and vetting deficiencies. The White House highlights high visa overstay rates and lack of cooperation in accepting removable nationals as key factors.

title: Gold & silver prediction: What's gold rate outlook for June 5 - should you buy or sell?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold prices are showing bullish signals, recently surpassing ₹97,700 with a target of ₹99,900, supported by geopolitical tensions and expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts. Similarly, silver has surged, potentially breaking its all-time high, targeting ₹103,700 and ₹105,000, driven by safe-haven demand and industrial applications. Investors should monitor key support levels for both metals.

title: Sunflower seeds: High in zinc, magnesium, and mood-lifting benefits
content: Sunflower seeds, nutritional powerhouses, offer benefits from mood regulation to heart health. Rich in zinc and magnesium, they support immune function and mental well-being. Unsaturated fats lower cholesterol, while vitamin E protects skin. Fiber aids digestion, linking gut health to mood.

title: 'I did not die, I was killed': Cry posters at funeral of honeymooner murdered in Meghalaya
content: Raja Raghuvanshi was discovered murdered in Meghalaya, and his wife, Sonam, is still missing, prompting allegations of a botched investigation. The family is demanding a CBI probe and Army assistance, claiming local police are not taking the case seriously.

title: Trump blocks visas for new foreign students at Harvard; here's how University responded
content: Harvard University is facing a six-month ban on admitting new foreign students due to an executive order issued by US president Trump, citing national security concerns. University officials are calling the ban a retaliatory measure that violates Harvard's constitutional rights, stemming from tensions over the university's resistance to providing internal records.

title: Bengaluru stampede: 'Sad day' - Cricketers mourn tragedy during RCB's celebrations
content: A celebratory homecoming for Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory turned tragic as a stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium resulted in 11 fatalities and over 30 injuries. Overwhelmed by the massive crowd, security measures failed, leading to chaos. Cricket icons like Sachin Tendulkar and Anil Kumble expressed grief, highlighting the need for improved safety during public events.

title: Kill the Bill: Elon Musk declares war on Donald Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill'
content: The Bill in question? H.R.1, passed by the House on May 22. A sprawling $4 trillion mega-package that extends Trump’s 2017 tax cuts, pumps funds into border security, expands defence spending—and raises the debt ceiling to eyewatering new heights. MAGA Republicans call it “historic.” Musk calls it “a disgusting abomination.”

title: Watch: Virat Kohli's gesture to Shreyas Iyer's father wins hearts
content: Virat Kohli led Royal Challengers Bengaluru to their first IPL title, defeating Punjab Kings in a thrilling final. A touching moment saw Kohli seeking blessings from Shreyas Iyer's father, highlighting sportsmanship. However, celebrations turned tragic when a stampede during a public event in Bengaluru resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries, leaving Kohli and the team devastated.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock recommendations for June 5
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha suggests a cautious outlook for Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential declines to 24300/24100 and 54700/54500, respectively. He recommends buying Zydus Lifesciences, targeting 980, Great Eastern Shipping Company with a target of 1060, and Tata Motors, expecting a rise to 770.

title: 26/11 Mumbai terror attack: Youngest survivor gets a house more than 5 years after moving court
content: Devika Rotawan, a survivor and key witness of the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, has finally been allotted a Mhada house after a five-year legal battle. The Bombay High Court intervened, directing the state to provide housing under the EWS scheme. Rotawan, who faced displacement and discrimination, expresses joy at having a stable home and remains determined to serve the nation.

title: Op Sindoor: Did India mean to send a message to China too? Shashi Tharoor responds
content: Leading an all-party delegation in the US, MP Shashi Tharoor lauded Operation Sindoor, India's military action against terrorist infrastructure in Pakistan. Tharoor highlighted the operation's success in bypassing Chinese radar systems and sending a clear message to Pakistan.

title: Need to develop different approach for crowd management: Tharoor on Bengaluru stampede
content: State Home Minister G. Parameshwara said Karnataka Govt will formulate a new Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for mega events, meetings and celebrations aimed at preventing any untoward incidents

title: PM Modi launches Aravalli Green Wall Project, expands 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign
content: PM Modi launched a special initiative to reforest the 700-km Aravalli mountain range that stretches from Delhi to Gujarat

title: Telangana student deported from US; Hyderabad consultancy firm’s MD admits to have sent 15 students using forged documents
content: A consultancy firm’s MD admitted to having sent 15 students abroad over the past five years using forged documents to secure admissions

title: On World Environment Day, PM Modi plants sindoor sapling at residence
content: PM Modi said during his recent visit to Kutch, a group of women who had ​shown remarkable courage during the 1971 war met and presented him with the saplings

title: Karnataka govt to formulate new SOP for mega events, celebrations
content: Home Minister G. Parameshwara said that the government will take strict measures identifying the lapses that led to the stampede near the stadium

title: Two dead, seven injured as SUV hits auto in A.P.’s Atmakur
content: Two of the injured persons were referred to Nellore GGH, while the rest five were admitted into Atmakur government hospital

title: Karnataka government accords ‘royal felicitation’ to Royal Challengers Bengaluru for IPL 2025 victory
content: Thousands of frenzied fans dressed in RCB jerseys waved red flags and gave a grand welcome to the new IPL champions

title: Five Kamal Haasan films that courted controversies
content: What sets the latest controversy apart is that, unlike past instances where the objections were over the film’s content or title, this time, the row has nothing to do with the movie itself.

title: Assam flood situation grim, 7 lakh affected
content: The current wave of floods has affected 1,494 villages in 66 revenue circles, the highest of 339 villages in Sribhumi, 189 in Nagaon, 166 in Cachar and 156 in Hailakandi districts.

title: Beyond tragic: Tendulkar condoles Chinnaswamy stampede deaths
content: Former cricketers AB de Villiers, Anil Kumble and Yuvraj Singh also expressed their sympathy for the victims

title: Odisha police turn Medha Patkar, activists away from Rayagada where resistance against bauxite mining simmering
content: Rayagada district has barred 24 activists from entering and participating in any protests or sit-ins in the district for two months starting June 4

title: Three women arrested for attack on Gaya doctor who treated rape survivor’s mother
content: Leader of the opposition in Bihar Legislative Assembly Tejashwi Yadav shared the video of the incident on his social media account ‘X’ saying that the situation in Bihar is worse than that under the Taliban.

title: Consecration of ‘Raja Ram’, other deities held at Ram Temple in Ayodhya
content: CM Adityanath offered prayers at the Ram Temple, had darshan of the ‘Ram Darbar’ on the first floor, and visited Hanumangarhi temple nearby

title: Those who think working in national interest is anti-party activity need to question themselves: Shashi Tharoor
content: “We didn't need persuading by anybody, because our signal from day one was, if Pakistan hits back, we will hit them even harder. If they stop, we will stop. We said that from the first day. We said it on the last day,” says Shashi Tharoor

title: No FIR on stampede deaths during RCB victory parade in Bengaluru, police file 11 UDRs
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah had ordered a magisterial inquiry into the alleged lapses and causes for the stampede

title: One lakh people from Vizianagaram will take part in Yoga programme at Bhimili: Joint Collector Sedhu Madhavan
content: As the Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to participate in the event, the district is planning to make it as a grand success

title: Bengaluru-Mangaluru National Highway blocked by protesters near Solur
content: Farmers in and around Magadi in Ramanagara district organised a protest seeking implementation of Hemavathy Express Link project

title: Flood situation improves in Manipur, security forces continue rescue operation
content: The overflowing Imphal, Kongba and Nambul rivers breached several embankments, aggravating the situation, they added, officials said.

title: Producers of Malayalam hit film Manjummel Boys summoned for questioning in cheating case
content: The Maradu Police have asked the producers of Manjummel Boys to appear for interrogation, in a case registered in connection with the alleged denial of the principal amount and profit share to an investor in the movie.

title: On day of Bengaluru RCB IPL victory stampede, BMRCL posted record ridership of 9.66 lakh commuters
content: The fan frenzy that gripped Bengaluru saw lakhs thronging the streets and public spaces. To manage the overwhelming rush, BMRCL allowed commuters to enter without scanning QR code tickets, smart cards, or tokens

title: 59 tourists airlifted from north Sikkim as rescue ops resume
content: Sikkim Nationalised Transport (SNT) has deployed buses to help these rescued tourists reach Siliguri in West Bengal

title: Karnataka High Court seeks report on stampede during RCB victory celebrations in Bengaluru
content: A division bench comprising acting Chief Justice V. Kameswar Rao and Justice C. M. Joshi told A-G Shashikiran Shetty that the bench would hear the matter at 2.30 p.m.

title: 3,000 participants enliven ‘Yogandhra’ awareness event at Chandragiri Fort in A.P.
content: The ambitious event was  conducted by the district machinery at the famed Chandragiri fort  near Tirupati on June 4, 2025, to create awareness about the forthcoming ‘Yogandhra’ programme.

title: Over 100 people test positive for COVID in West Bengal, active cases now at 538
content: During the same period, 61 people also recovered from the infection, Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare said.

title: Those behind Indore tourist's murder will be brought to book: Meghalaya CM
content: It is important to get to the facts of the situation so that the truth comes out. Therefore, we will take whatever steps are required to be taken... then we will take an appropriate decision, says Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma

title: 11 years of NDA: Govt devoted to welfare of poor, says PM Modi
content: Mr. Modi is set to complete the first year of his third straight term in office on June 9, marking an uninterrupted 11 years in power.

title: Have publicly pledged to refuse post-retirement jobs: CJI BR Gavai
content: “Judiciary acts as a counterbalance against the arbitrary exercise of power… Certain fundamental principles, such as democracy, rule of law, and the separation of powers, are inviolable and cannot be altered,” the CJI said.

title: Kerala gold investment fraud: Proprietors of now defunct jewellery arrested in ten more cases
content: Their bail applications in ten cases were rejected, and they would be presented before a court in the city on Thursday, June 5, 2025.

title: Extremely rewarding day meeting U.S. congressmen, senators at Capitol Hill: Tharoor
content: He said every single person the delegation met so far immediately not only condemned resolutely the terrorist attack upon India, expressed their outrage and sympathy, but also explicitly endorsed India's right to defend itself against terrorism

title: Chewing tobacco increases oral cancer risk by over 19 times in elderly people, study says
content: The study was an observational case-control study involving 120 adults and was carried out in a tertiary care dental institution situated in Kaiwara in the Chikkaballapur district, which is 70 km away from Bengaluru

title: Tirupati, Rajampet MPs take part in ‘Vennu Potu Dinam’ at Sarvepalli
content: MLC Parvathareddy Chandrasekhar Reddy and other YSRCP leaders organised a rally and protest at VRC Centre in Nellore

title: Pension sanctioned to 55 people at special Adalat in Nellore
content: The GPF issues related to 15 persons were resolved and authorisation letters were given by Shanthi Priya Sarella, Principal Accountant General (A&E), AP during Pension and GPF Adalat

title: Oilers win a thriller: Grades for both teams, what to watch in Game 2
content: Edmonton strikes first in the 2025 Stanley Cup Final. Here's how it happened and what comes next Friday.

title: Draisaitl's OT goal caps Oilers' rally in Game 1 win
content: Leon Draisaitl scored on a power play in overtime after the Oilers erased a multigoal deficit to beat the defending champion Panthers 4-3 in Game 1 of the Stanley Cup Final rematch Wednesday night.

title: Atwood pounces on IBB try to lift Texas at WCWS
content: Reese Atwood hit a go-ahead, two-run single for Texas when Texas Tech ace NiJaree Canady was trying to walk her, and the Longhorns beat the Red Raiders 2-1 in Game 1 of the Women's College World Series finals Wednesday night.

title: Manfred 'paid attention' to Trump support of Rose
content: Rob Manfred took President Donald Trump's support of Pete Rose into account when the MLB commissioner decided that permanent bans by the sport ended with death.

title: Twins' Lopez out 8-12 weeks with shoulder injury
content: Twins right-hander Pablo Lopez is expected to miss 8-12 weeks with a Grade 2 strain in his right shoulder.

title: Ronaldo fires Portugal past Germany to NL final
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored the winner as Portugal fought back to beat Germany 2-1 on Wednesday and reach the Nations League final.

title: Red Sox win on shortest walk-off HR on record
content: Ceddanne Rafaela curled a 308-foot home run around the Pesky Pole in the bottom of the ninth inning on Wednesday, and the Red Sox rallied after trailing four different times to beat the Angels 11-9.

title: Michigan offers 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr.
content: Michigan has extended an offer to class of 2027 safety Charles Woodson Jr., opening its recruitment of the son of Pro Football Hall of Famer and Wolverines 1997 Heisman Trophy winner Charles Woodson.

title: Source: No investigation into Storm assistant
content: The WNBA followed up on an allegation that a Storm assistant coach cursed at an Aces player after the teams' game Sunday, but no investigation was launched, a source said.

title: 🏀 Five Knicks questions after firing Thibodeau
content: NBA insiders examine why the Knicks parted ways with Thibodeau and which coaching candidates could be right for New York.

title: The Paul George Trade is about to deliver an NBA title
content: The Thunder and Pacers can trace their superstars and their cores back to trades involving the nine-time All-Star wing.

title: It takes a village? Inside the MLB ballpark model of the future
content: The Battery Atlanta is an enticing blueprint for teams. But creating an entire neighborhood is a hard act to follow.

title: 2025 FC 100: Yamal, Mbappe among best men's soccer players
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?
content: He defeated No. 3 Zverev in the quarterfinals -- but can Djokovic continue this level? In his way stands Sinner, and likely Alcaraz too.

title: The almost-impossible-to-believe story of Loïs Boisson at the French Open
content: Boisson is the first women's wild card to reach the French Open semifinals since the Open era began. Here's how she did it.

title: NBA coaching carousel: Suns, Spurs, Nuggets find successors -- but what's next for the Knicks?
content: Which NBA coaching jobs are available? Which situations are the most appealing? We're breaking down each vacancy.

title: We pitched trade offers for three NFL stars: Landing spots for Ramsey, Cousins, Hendrickson
content: Kirk Cousins, Trey Hendrickson and Jalen Ramsey could all be traded soon. We crafted potential offers -- and picked the best deals.

title: Who will benefit most from signing with or being traded to a new team
content: Who gained most from moving to a new organization over the past few months? Let's evaluate 15 additions.

title: A big bullpen bust in L.A.? Is Soto unlucky? Are the O's cooked? An early verdict on 2025 disappointments
content: A number of teams and stars are still struggling two months into the season. Do their slow starts define who they are in 2025?

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: Latest from PGA Tour and LIV Golf: McIlroy's back and DeChambeau is everywhere
content: After scuffling at the PGA Championship Rory McIlroy is back in action at the Canadian Open. Meanwhile, from LIV Golf events to social media shoots, Bryson DeChambeau seems to never slow down.

title: 'I'm not naïve': Hugh Freeze knows Auburn needs to start winning soon
content: The Tigers have scored recruiting and portal wins of late -- now they have to deliver where it matters most.

title: U.S. visa uncertainties put college rosters in a bind
content: College coaches and international athletes are stuck in an unnerving limbo, saying they're unsure how to plan for recent changes in U.S. student visa policy that could potentially wreak havoc on their rosters this year.

title: Report: Brailsford to scale back Man United role
content: Manchester United's football operations are undergoing yet more change with Dave Brailsford scaling back his role, a source told The Associated Press.

title: USMNT's Steffen (knee) set to miss Gold Cup
content: Zack Steffen injured a knee and became the second goalkeeper dropped from the United States' training camp ahead of the Concacaf Gold Cup.

title: Ancelotti: Brazil need Vini to replicate Madrid form
content: Brazil must help striker Vinicius Jr rediscover the form he has displayed at Real Madrid, new national team coach Carlo Ancelotti said on Wednesday.

title: Mexico's Lozano, Martín left off Gold Cup team
content: Mexico will be without Hirving Lozano and Henry Martín for upcoming friendlies vs. Switzerland and Turkey, and the duo will also miss the Concacaf Gold Cup due to hamstring injuries.

title: Inzaghi named Al Hilal boss after Inter Milan exit
content: Simone Inzaghi has been named as Al Hilal's new head coach on a two-year contract, the Saudi Pro League club confirmed Wednesday.

title: Delap joins Chelsea from Ipswich in $40.6m deal
content: Chelsea have bolstered their forward line with the signing of 22-year-old striker Liam Delap from Ipswich Town.

title: Finland mistakenly call up retired 51-year-old
content: Finland women's national team manager has apologised for mistakenly calling up a long-retired 51-year-old for this week's game against Serbia.

title: Stand aside, Messi and Ronaldo: Yamal and Doué are coming for you
content: Champions Leagues, World Cups, Ballons d'Or ... get ready for PSG's Désiré Doué and Barcelona's Lamine Yamal to become this generation's Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Can underdog Julianna Peña pull off another title-fight shocker?
content: Peña enters her UFC 316 co-main event versus Kayla Harrison with long odds for the fourth straight fight.

title: Surely he's aware Pahalgam terrorists still not brought to justice: Congress on PM's J&K visit

title: World Environment Day | Ceiling fans are used almost everyday; their power consumption can be cut by half by switching to BLDC tech
content: A BLDC fan — which runs on Direct Current — consumes less energy. Similarly, a conventional tube light of 40 Watt consumes 0.4 kWh. And, a LED Batten of 20Watt consumes 0.2 kWh, according to the Bureau of Energy Efficiency (BEE).

title: Man Accused Of Killing First Wife Now Main Suspect In Murder Of Second

title: 2-Foot-Long Monitor Lizard Emerges From Toilet In Rajasthan

content: The Congress party has exhorted the international community to understand and support India's stand on terrorism emanating from Pakistan, the party's president Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday.

title: "Approximately 8 Lakh People Showed Up": Karnataka Home Minister On Stampede

title: 'Extremely Rewarding Day': Shashi Tharoor On Meeting US Congressmen, Senators

title: PM Modi Plants Sindoor Sapling,  A Symbol Of Women's Valor, Inspiration

title: BSF Trains Villagers In J&K Border Areas On How Firearms Work, Self-Defence

title: Opinion: Opinion | If Trump's Tariffs Are For China, Why Are They Hurting Canada Instead?
content: While China is the world's largest steel manufacturer and exporter, it is only the 10th-largest steel supplier to America. Compare this to the 22% coming from Canada, and it becomes clear who is impacted more by this move.
